original_HC_definition: The person or people who performed the inventory
label: Sampling Performed By
rdfs_comment [DEFINITION]: A person, group, or organization responsible for recording the Event.
dcterms_description [COMMENTS]: The sampling Event could be of any hierarchy. In the case of a higher level Event (parent) include all the organizations or people involved in the children Events that contributed to the parent Event. Recommended best practice is to separate multiple values in a list with space vertical bar space ( | ).
examples: "`North American Butterlfy Association`, `KK Wall`, `JJ Green`, `LL Pink and FF Grey | Aspen Center for Environmental Studies`"

original_HC_definition: The agent(s) who performed taxonomic identifications in the field
notes: https://github.com/tdwg/hc/issues/7
label: Identified By
rdfs_comment [DEFINITION]: A list (concatenated and separated) of names of people, groups, or organizations who assigned the Taxon to the subject.
dcterms_description [COMMENTS]: Recommended best practice is to separate multiple values in a list with space vertical bar space ( | ).

original_HC_label: citation reference of taxonomic authority for identification
original_HC_definition: The published reference to the taxonomic authority used in the checklist
notes: similar to issue https://github.com/tdwg/hc/issues/7
label: Identification References
rdfs_comment [DEFINITION]: A list (concatenated and separated) of references (publication, global unique identifier, URI) used in the Identification.
dcterms_description [COMMENTS]: Recommended best practice is to separate mulitple values in a list with space vertical bar space ( | ).
examples: "`Aves del Noroeste Patagonico. Christie et al. 2004.`, `Stebbins, R. Field Guide to Western Reptiles and Amphibians. 3rd Edition. 2003. | Irschick, D.J. and Shaffer, H.B. (1997). The polytypic species revisited: Morphological differentiation among tiger salamanders (Ambystoma tigrinum) (Amphibia: Caudata). Herpetologica, 53(1), 30-49.`"

original_HC_definition: Author-reported number of separate sites inventoried
notes:
Complete dcterms_description (comments) when issue is solved. https://github.com/tdwg/hc/issues/8
Check some ontologies to refer to
label: Site Count
rdfs_comment [DEFINITION]: Total number of individual sites surveyed during the Event.
dcterms_description [COMMENTS]: Site refers to the location at which observations are made or samples/measurements are taken. The site could be of any hierarchy.

original_HC_definition: Author-reported hierarchical sample design e.g. sampled subunits nested with larger units
notes: Complete dcterms_description (comments) when issue is solved. https://github.com/tdwg/hc/issues/8
label: Site Nesting Description
rdfs_comment [DEFINITION]: Textual description of the hierarchical sampling design.
dcterms_description [COMMENTS]: Site refers to the location at which observations are made or samples/measurements are taken. The site could be of any hierarchy.

original_HC_definition: Author-reported site names
notes: Proposed term name change. Complete dcterms_description (comments) when issue is solved. https://github.com/tdwg/hc/issues/8
label: Verbatim Site Names
rdfs_comment [DEFINITION]: A list (concatenated and separated) of original site names.
dcterms_description [COMMENTS]: Recommended best practice is to separate multiple values in a list with space vertical bar space ( | ). Site refers to the location at which observations are made or samples/measurements are taken. The site could be of any hierarchy.
examples: "`East Coastal Fringe | St. Marks Wildlife Management Area`, `S1 | S2 | C1 | C2 | R14 | R22 | W1`"

original_HC_definition: Author-reported site information (utilizes terms below per site if more than one)
notes: Proposed term name change. Complete dcterms_description (comments) when issue is solved. https://github.com/tdwg/hc/issues/8
label: Verbatim Site Description
rdfs_comment [DEFINITION]: Original textual description of the site(s).
dcterms_description [COMMENTS]: Recommended best practice is to separate multiple values in a list with space vertical bar space ( | ). Site refers to the location at which observations are made or samples/measurements are taken. The site could be of any hierarchy.
examples: "`Wet flatwoods | Wet depression surrounded by mesic longleaf pine flatwoods | Ground cover of thick Andropogon spp., Sporobolus floridanus, Vaccinium spp, Rhynchospora spp., Centella erecta, Panicum rigidulum.`, `S=scrub | G=grassland | P=pasture | I=dunes | P=Bishop Pine Forest | R=Riparian | W=Redwood Forest`"

original_HC_label: total area covered by geospatial scope
original_HC_definition: Author's reported total area of the geospatial scope in km2
notes: https://github.com/tdwg/hc/issues/15
label: Geospatial Scope Area In Square Kilometers
rdfs_comment [DEFINITION]: Total area in km2 of the geospatial scope of the Event.
dcterms_description [COMMENTS]: Geospatial scope refers to the Event location reported using the dwc:Location class terms. This area is always greater than or equal to totalAreaSampledInSquareKilometers.

original_HC_label: total area covered by species inventory
original_HC_definition: Author's reported total area covered by effort to inventory species in km2 (always less than or equal to "geospatial scope" term above
notes: https://github.com/tdwg/hc/issues/15
label: Total Area Sampled In Square Kilometers
rdfs_comment [DEFINITION]: Total area in km2 surveyed during the Event.
dcterms_description [COMMENTS]: This area is always less than or equal to geospatialScopeAreaInSquareKilometers.

notes: New term
label: Event Duration
rdfs_comment [DEFINITION]: The length of the Event in the unit reported in hc:eventDurationUnit.
dcterms_description [COMMENTS]: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary. A hc:eventDuration should have a corresponding hc:eventDurationUnit.

original_HC_definition: The temporal units described for the time block (months, days, years)
notes: https://github.com/tdwg/hc/issues/9
label: Event Duration Unit
rdfs_comment [DEFINITION]: The temporal unit used to report hc:eventDuration.
dcterms_description [COMMENTS]: A hc:eventDurationUnit should have a corresponding hc:eventDuration.

original_HC_definition: Set of searched species during inventory
label: Target Taxonomic Scope
rdfs_comment [DEFINITION]: Taxonomic groups targeted for sampling during the Event.
dcterms_description [COMMENTS]: The Event could be of any hierarchy. In the case of a higher level Event (parent) include all taxonomic groups surveyed in the children Events that contributed to the parent Event. Recommended best practice is to separate multiple values in a list with space vertical bar space ( | ).

original_HC_definition: Set of species explicitly excluded from the inventory
label: Excluded Taxonomic Scope
rdfs_comment [DEFINITION]: Taxonomic groups explicitely excluded from sampling during the Event.
dcterms_description [COMMENTS]: The Event could be of any hierarchy.In the case of a higher level Event (parent) include all the taxonomic groups explicitely excluded from the children Events that contributed to the parent Event. Recommended best practice is to separate mulitple values in a list with space vertical bar space ( | ).

original_HC_definition: Type(s) of individuals included when sampling due to developmental stage. Pick list: "Adult/Reproductive/Juvenile/Larval/Seedling/Vegetative/Reproductive"
notes: related question posted to DwC repo: https://github.com/tdwg/dwc/issues/321
label: Target Life Stage Scope
rdfs_comment [DEFINITION]: The targeted age class(es) or life stage(s) of the organism(s)  sampled during the Event.
dcterms_description [COMMENTS]: This term is defined based on the definition of the Darwin Core term lifeStage (http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/terms/lifeStage). Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary and separate multiple values in a list with space vertical bar space ( | ).

original_HC_definition: Type(s) of individuals excluded when sampling due to developmental stage. Pick list: "Adult/Reproductive/Juvenile/Larval/Seedling/Vegetative/Reproductive"
notes: related question posted to DwC repo: https://github.com/tdwg/dwc/issues/321
label: Excluded Life Stage Scope
rdfs_comment [DEFINITION]: The explicitly excluded age class(es) or life stage(s) of the organism(s) sampled during the Event.
dcterms_description [COMMENTS]: This term is defined based on the definition of the Darwin Core term lifeStage (http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/terms/lifeStage). Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary and to separate multiple values in a list with space vertical bar space ( | ).

original_HC_definition: Distributional status explicitly included in inventory. Pick list: "Native/Non-Native/Invasive/Naturalized"
label: Target Degree Of Establishment Scope
rdfs_comment [DEFINITION]: Degree(s) of establishment targeted for sampling during the Event.
dcterms_description [COMMENTS]: This term is defined based on the definition of the Darwin Core term degreeOfEstablishment (http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/terms/degreeOfEstablishment). Recommended best practice is to use controlled value strings from the http://rs.tdwg.org/dwcdoe/ controlled vocabulary designated for use with the Darwin Core term degreeOfEstablishment. For details, refer to https://doi.org/10.3897/biss.3.38084. Separate multiple values in a list with space vertical bar space ( | ).

original_HC_definition: Distributional status explicitly exluded in inventory. Pick list: "Native/Non-Native/Invasive/Naturalized"
label: Excluded Degree Of Establishment Scope
rdfs_comment [DEFINITION]: Degree(s) of establishment explicitly excluded from sampling during the Event.
dcterms_description [COMMENTS]: This term is defined based on the definition of the Darwin Core term degreeOfEstablishment (http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/terms/degreeOfEstablishment). Recommended best practice is to use controlled value strings from the http://rs.tdwg.org/dwcdoe/ controlled vocabulary designated for use with the Darwin Core term degreeOfEstablishment. For details, refer to https://doi.org/10.3897/biss.3.38084. Separate multiple values in a list with space vertical bar space ( | ).

original_HC_definition: Growth form explicitly included in inventory. Current controlled vocab. list: tree/shrub.
notes: related question posted to DwC repo: https://github.com/tdwg/dwc/issues/321
label: Target Growth Form Scope
rdfs_comment [DEFINITION]: Targeted growth form(s) or habit(s) of the organism(s) sampled during the Event.
dcterms_description [COMMENTS]: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary and separate multiple values in a list with space vertical bar space ( | ).

original_HC_definition: Growth form explicitly excluded in inventory. Current controlled vocab. list: tree/shrub.
notes: related question posted to DwC repo: https://github.com/tdwg/dwc/issues/321
label: Excluded Growth Form Scope
rdfs_comment [DEFINITION]: Explicitly excluded growth form(s) or habit(s) of the organism(s) sampled during the Event.
dcterms_description [COMMENTS]: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary and separate multiple values in a list with space vertical bar space ( | ).

original_HC_definition: A verbatim text description of the habitats reported as included in the surveys
notes: is this part of geospatial scope?
label: Habitat Scope
rdfs_comment [DEFINITION]: Targeted habitat(s) sampled during the Event.
dcterms_description [COMMENTS]: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary and separate the values in a list with space vertical bar space ( | ).

original_HC_definition: A verbatim text description of the habitats explicitly reported as not included in the surveys
notes: is this part of geospatial scope?
label: Excluded Habitat Scope
rdfs_comment [DEFINITION]: Explicitly excluded habitat(s) sampled during the Event.
dcterms_description [COMMENTS]: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary and separate multiple values in a list with space vertical bar space ( | ).

original_HC_label: reported on the ground weather conditions
original_HC_definition: Weather or climate conditions experienced during the survey (e.g., drought, frost)
notes: is this part of geospatial scope?
label: Reported Weather
rdfs_comment [DEFINITION]: A list of weather or climatic conditions present at the time of the Event.
dcterms_description [COMMENTS]: Recommended best practice is to use a key:value encoding schema for a data interchange format such as JSON.

original_HC_definition: Adverse conditions that affected the survey or survey sites (e.g., fire, floods)
notes: is this part of geospatial scope?
label: Reported Extreme Conditions
rdfs_comment [DEFINITION]: A description of any extreme weather or environmental condition(s) that may have affected the Event.
examples: "`flooding during week 3 of surveys`, `rockslide at site 2`"

original_HC_definition: Inventory type can be restricted search, open search, opportunistic search, trap, incidental or adventitous or material sample. Recommend using a subclasee of bco:taxonomic inventory process.
label: Inventory Type
rdfs_comment [DEFINITION]: The type(s) of search process(es) used to conduct the inventory.
dcterms_description [COMMENTS]:
This term is only relevant if the Event is an inventory. Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary such as the terms included under the Biological Collections Ontology superclass 'taxonomic inventory process' (http://
 purl.obolibrary.org/obo/BCO_0000047). Separate multiple values in a list with space vertical bar space ( | ).

original_HC_definition: Compiled data is ancillary data that was not directly collected by authors but assembled from other sources. Inventories can be compiled only, survey only, or both.
label: Compilation Type
rdfs_comment [DEFINITION]: A statement specifying whether data reported are derived from sampling event(s), anicillary data compiled from other sources, or a combination of both.
dcterms_description [COMMENTS]: This term is only relevant if the Event is an inventory. Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

original_HC_definition: Compilation types include expert and local knowledge, museum specimens, literature, or other sources
notes: Proposed term name change.
label: Compilation Source Types
rdfs_comment [DEFINITION]: Type(s) of data sources contributing to the compilation reported.
dcterms_description [COMMENTS]: This term is only relevant if the Event is a compilation in which one or more types of data sources were used. Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary and separate multiple values in a list with space vertical bar space ( | ).

original_HC_definition: The published name of the protocol used to carry out survey (e.g., Pollard walk)
notes:
Suggestion made to DwC to tweak definition slightly (to include plurals) and to add comment. See: https://github.com/tdwg/dwc/issues/322
Screen reader support enabled.
first round review suggested to use dwc:samplingProtocol
Difficult to map to dwc::samplingProtocol because the mapping would be 3 to 1
Group discussion decided to keep it as a separate term
label: Protocol Name
rdfs_comment [DEFINITION]: A categorical descriptive name for the method(s) used during the Event.
dcterms_description [COMMENTS]: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary and separate multiple values in a list with space vertical bar space ( | ).

original_HC_definition: Any variations in the published protocol. For compilations that don't have a standard protocol or have an unpublished protocol, details are presented here.
notes:
Included in samplingProtocol
First round review suggested to use dwc:samplingProtocol
Group discussion decided to keep it as a separate term
label: Protocol Description
rdfs_comment [DEFINITION]: A detailed description of the method(s) used during the Event.
dcterms_description [COMMENTS]: This description should be associated with reporting of protocolName. This may include deviations from the published protocol referred to in protocolReference. Good practices may include instruments used, calibration, etc.
examples: "`Three conventional harp traps (3.2m ht x 2.2m w) were established in flight path zones for a period of 4 hrs at dawn and dusk for a total of 10 trap nights. Traps were visited on an hourly basis during each deployment period and the trap catch recorded for species, size, weight, sex, age and maternal status.`"

original_HC_definition: DOI, URL or ISBN to the published protocol reference if available
notes:
Included in samplingProtocol
First round review suggested to use dwc:samplingProtocol
Group discussion decided to keep it as a separate term
label: Protocol Reference
rdfs_comment [DEFINITION]: The reference(s) to the method(s) used during the Event.
dcterms_description [COMMENTS]: Recommended best practice is to separate multiple values in a list with space vertical bar space ( | ).
examples: "`Penguins from space: faecal stains reveal the location of emperor penguin colonies, https://doi.org/10.1111/j.1466-8238.2009.00467.x`, `Takats et al. 2001. Guidelines for Nocturnal Owl Monitoring in North America. Beaverhill Bird Observatory and Bird Studies Canada, Edmonton, Alberta. 32 pp., http://www.bsc-eoc.org/download/Owl.pdf`"

original_HC_definition: Did the survey results include number of individuals captured per species? (yes/no)
label: Is Abundance Reported
rdfs_comment [DEFINITION]: A statement about whether the number of organisms collected or observed is reported.
dcterms_description [COMMENTS]: If the Event is a compilation that contains at least one reported abundance, the value should be 'true'. Typically abundance values reported would be associated with related occurrences, either under the term dwc:individualCount or the combination of terms dwc:organismQuantity and dwc:organismQuantityType.

original_HC_definition: What value, if any, was used a maximum cap on reported abundances? (yes/no)
label: Is Abundance Cap Reported
rdfs_comment [DEFINITION]: A statement about whether a maximum number of organisms is reported, as specified or restricted by the protocol used.
dcterms_description [COMMENTS]: If the Event is a compilation that contains at least one reported abundance capped, the value should be 'true'. Values of abundance cap should be captured under the term hc:abundanceCap.

notes: New term. Implementation advice: if there is a non-Null value provided here, code isAbundanceCapReported boolean field to automatic=YES
label: Abundance Cap
rdfs_comment [DEFINITION]: Maximum number of organisms reported.
dcterms_description [COMMENTS]: If the Event is a compilation that contains at least one reported abundance capped, the value should be the maximum abundance cap among the ones reported.

original_HC_definition: In vegetation surveys, was cover metric reported as output (yes/no)
label: Is Vegetation Cover Reported
rdfs_comment [DEFINITION]: A statement about whether a vegetation cover metric is reported.
dcterms_description [COMMENTS]: If the Event is a compilation that contains at least one reported vegetation cover metric, the value should be 'true'. Typically values or description of vegetation cover would be captured under the term hc:verbatimSiteDescription.

original_HC_definition: Did the authors report species expected in the survey that were not found? (yes/no)
label: Is Absence Reported
rdfs_comment [DEFINITION]: A statement about whether taxonomic absences are reported.
dcterms_description [COMMENTS]: If the Event is a compilation that contains at least one reported taxonomic absence, the value should be 'true'. Absences could be reported at any taxonomic level.

original_HC_definition: List of taxa reported absence(s) at whatever taxonomic level reported
notes: Suggested new name: notRecordedTaxa
label: Absent Taxa
rdfs_comment [DEFINITION]: A list (concatenated and separated) of taxa reported absent during the Event.
dcterms_description [COMMENTS]: Absences could be reported at any taxonomic level. Recommended best practice is to separate multiple values in a list with space vertical bar space ( | ).
examples: "`Parabuteo unicinctus | Geranoaetus melanoleucus`, `Cetoniinae | Aclopinae | Cyclocephala modesta`"

original_HC_label: were specimen vouchers taken during survey?
original_HC_definition: Did the authors collect specimen vouchers? (yes/no)
notes: Check GGBN and materialSample task group.
label: Has Vouchers
rdfs_comment [DEFINITION]: A statement about whether specimen voucher(s) were collected during Event.
dcterms_description [COMMENTS]: If the Event is a compilation that contains at least one specimen voucher collected, the value should be 'true'.

original_HC_definition: If collected, the name of the repository where vouchers were deposited
notes: Check GGBN and materialSample task group.
label: Voucher Institution
rdfs_comment [DEFINITION]: A list (concatenated and separated) of the name(s) or acronym(s) of the institution(s) where voucher(s) collected during the Event were deposited.
dcterms_description [COMMENTS]: Recommended best practice is to separate multiple values in a list with space vertical bar space ( | ).

original_HC_label: were samples taken from organisms during survey?
original_HC_definition: Did the author collect samples from organisms during the survey?
notes: Proposed term name change. Check GGBN and materialSample task group.
label: Has Material Samples
rdfs_comment [DEFINITION]: A statement about whether material sample(s) were collected during the Event.
dcterms_description [COMMENTS]: This term is based on the definition of the Darwin Core Class MaterialSample (http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/terms/MaterialSample). If the Event is a compilation that contains at least one material sample, the value should be 'true'.

original_HC_label: what kind of samples were taken from organisms?
original_HC_definition: Sample types include blood, tissue, fecal, etc.
notes: Proposed term name change. Check GGBN and materialSample task group.
label: Material Sample Types
rdfs_comment [DEFINITION]: A list (concatenated and separated) of material sample type(s) collected during the Event.
dcterms_description [COMMENTS]: This term is based on the definition of the Darwin Core Class MaterialSample (http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/terms/MaterialSample). Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary and separate multiple values in a list with space vertical bar space ( | ).

original_HC_definition: Measured as "no/partial/complete".
label: Is Sampling Effort Reported
rdfs_comment [DEFINITION]: A statement about whether sampling effort associated with the Event is reported.
dcterms_description [COMMENTS]: If the Event is a compilation that contains at least one sampling effort reported, the value should be 'true'. Typically values of effort would be captured under the terms hc:samplingEffortValue and hc:samplingEffortUnit.

notes: New term
label: Sampling Effort Protocol
rdfs_comment [DEFINITION]: A description of or reference to (publication or URL) the method(s) used to determine the sampling effort.
dcterms_description [COMMENTS]: This description should be associated with reporting of hc:samplingEffortValue and hc:samplingEffortUnit. This is a specialisation of hc:protocolDescritption focused on the effort as distinct from the survey method itself. The effort relates to the intensity of sampling and therefore can assist in interpreting measures of completeness.
examples: "`40 box traps deployed at even spacings along 4 parallel 100m transects placed 50m apart and visited at 6 hourly intervals over a 48 hour period`, `2 people occupying a bird hide for a period of 8 hours and undertaking a 30 minute count of species within the 150 degree field of view every 2 hours`, `A single baited camera trap station with motion sensor trigger, deployed for a period of 10 days and configured for detecting large fauna moving through a known traffic way`"

notes: New term
label: samplingEffortValue
rdfs_comment [DEFINITION]: The numeric value of sampling effort expended during the Event in the unit reported in hc:samplingEffortUnit.
dcterms_description [COMMENTS]: This term is meant to capture the total sampling effort value, to express details use hc:samplingEffortProtocol. For compilations it is recommend not to infer effort.

notes: New term
label: Sampling Effort Unit
rdfs_comment [DEFINITION]: The unit used to report hc:samplingEffortValue.
dcterms_description [COMMENTS]: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary. hc:samplingEffortUnit should always be used in conjunction with hc:samplingEffortValue.

original_HC_definition: Choices for this field: "No, not reported", "Yes, reported as complete", "Yes, reported as incomplete".
notes: Proposed term name change.
label: taxonCompletenessReported
rdfs_comment [DEFINITION]: Statement about whether, given the hc:targetTaxonomicScope, the Event yielded a complete list of the expected taxa.
dcterms_description [COMMENTS]: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary. For compilations it is recommended not to infer completeness.

original_HC_label: if reported incomplete, was how incompleteness assessed?
original_HC_definition: If author reported their assessment of incompleteness, capture author reported measurement or inferred assessment of incompleteness.
notes: Proposed term name change.
label: taxonCompletenessProtocol
rdfs_comment [DEFINITION]: A description of or reference to (publication, URL) the method(s) used to determined hc:taxonCompletenessReported.
dcterms_description [COMMENTS]: This term allows users to determine how comprehensively an area has been sampled.  Recommended best practice is to separate multiple values in a list with space vertical bar space ( | ).
examples: "`Census | Based on sampling effort`,  `Based on species accumulation curves`"
